reviewText: I've been hearing a lot of talk about pizza. Making pizza, eating pizza, loving pizza, hating pizza. Pizza pizza pizza. Well this game is why. Never before have we had the privilege to literally make pizza from chicken scratch. This 'game' (I myself would refer to it as a simulator; simulating perfection that is) gives us a first-hand look on where these literal slices of heaven come from. Right down to its roots. Fighting off bears, milking goats, watering grass, it has every detail. This - is how you make pizza. You don't just slap some dough in the oven. No, you raise it up from the ground, from the dirt. You pour blood and sweat into this. No pain no gain, this is what pizza's all about. You think it's just another food? Yeah, I guess you would, because you obviously haven't played this game - being the reason you're turning to a pizza god for a review. I have nothing but positive things to say about this masterpiece, this... Pizza Party. It is a party alright. Yes sir, a party indeed. Grab your watering cans, bear cages, and spatula boys, because it's your turn to make a pizza, to make your own slice of heaven on earth,
voteText: 31 of 37 people (84%) found this review helpful 4 people found this review funny

reviewText: You thought this game was easy? GUESS AGAIN.  You have certain goals you need to achieve in a certain timeframe to earn stars.  The slightest misclick or delay in following things in the proper order will ensure YOU WILL FAIL TO ACHIEVE GREATNESS!  I tried following various guides and end up misclicking the well fountain causing me to lose 19 coins and end up missing the target time.  This game is more difficult than Dark Souls and Super Meat Boy combined.
